<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
Iodine-131 is a radioactive isotope of the element iodine. Fig. 10.1 shows the nuclide notation for a nucleus of iodine-131.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[477, 109, 526, 144]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{131}{53}\mathrm{I}\]

<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[457, 155, 537, 174]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 10.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 187, 180, 205]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 186, 710, 205]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[411, 217, 920, 235]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 311, 866, 330]]<|/det|>
When a nucleus of iodine-131 decays, it emits a beta \((\beta)\) -particle and a gamma \((\gamma)\) ray.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 342, 588, 361]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 404, 920, 422]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 420, 920, 439]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 451, 485, 469]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 466, 470, 484]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 496, 764, 515]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[320, 621, 920, 638]]<|/det|>
